intro: Cyrtandra ootensis var. quaylei, commonly known as the Ootacamund Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its lanceolate, serrated leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
